page.title: 10LANDSCAPE
page.content: In the South lie the Gog Magog Hills, a small but notable chalk outcrop, rising to the dizzy height of 45 metres at Limepit Hill. The North Eastern corner includes part of Fulbourne Glen, now drained, and providing rich agricultural land - peas, beans, beet and wheat being the main crops. The rest of the area is mainly flat and well drained, suitable for farming or housing. Cherry Hinton and Fulbourn are the main settlements. Cherry Hinton, lying nearer to Cambridge, is mainly a dormitory village, and is growing considerably in size, with a huge new development planned. Fulbourne is also largely a dormitory and commuter settlement. Both village contain a great mixture of housing, reflecting their historic development.
